item.description:
NOSFERATU - THE CLASSIC VAMPIRE SILENT FILM - 1922

1 HR 34 MIN

     F.W. Murnau's German silent classic is the original and some say scariest DRACULA adaptation, taking Bram Stoker's novel and turning it into a haunting, shadowy dream full of dread. Count Orlok, the rodentlike vampire frighteningly portrayed by Max Schreck, is perhaps the most animalistic screen portrayal of a vampire ever filmed.    

     Now, thanks to John Cavaliere and composer and musician Steve Asetta, silent films are once more being shown at Lyric Hall, though with new accompaniment.
    Asetta, primarily a jazz musician, has been scoring silent films and putting together small orchestras to play the music, live, while classic silent films are shown at the classic theater.
 

With an Original Score by THE LYRIC HALL THEATER ORCHESTRA:
Steve Asetta,saxophones and clarinets,
Will Iannuzzi,accordian,piano,xylophone,
Mike Paolucci, drums and percussion

http://www.connecticutmag.com/Connecticut-Magazine/June-2011/Celluloid-Dreams/

There will be a $10.00 admission fee and a reservation WILL BE NECESSARY in advance at BEST VIDEO.

Purchase a ticket, cash only at best video in Hamden, you have to go down there.

BEST VIDEO
1842 Whitney Ave
Hamden Ct

Tickets purchased through Best Video 1-203-287-9286

Another option is to Call the orchestra director Steve Assetta and get information on where to mail your $10.00 - 203-209-5369. 

com/articles/2011/05/20/entertainment/doc4dd3e146a29bc522965173.txt?viewmode=default

 

 

 

As an added feature in the Westville neighborhood there TWO opening receptions:

 Photographer Hank Paper - Cuba: Arrested Splendor

Artist talk at 3:30, also Live Cuban Jazz Music by David Chevan (bass), Jesse Chevan (percussion), Noah Chevan (trumpet).

Kehler Liddell Gallery

873 Whalley Avenue

New Haven,CT

203-389-9555 

3-6PM

So join us for the film and reception or one or the other!

About: This exhibition will explore the philosophical fences, lines and cages that we build between and around ourselves as nations, societies and individuals.  For his gallery debut, Friedes will present massive steel cages that viewers may open and enter and lock.Paper will present street photographs from Cuba that will review the impact of the most enduring trade embargo in modern history.

 

 

PATRICIA BEATTY ARTIST RECEPTION AT DASILVA GALLERY 

Join DaSilva Gallery this evening to celebrate the opening of Patricia Beatty new solo exhibit.  "I am a collector. The visual I gather are manifested in my art using the ancient language of form and color. My mixed media paintings are influenced by numerous and often unrelated forces and my inspiration is drawn from intuitive feelings and quiet perceptions of my sorroundings."

 

DaSilva Gallery

897 Whalley Ave

New Haven

203-387-2539
